[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: update_reward_buffer()] [Timestamp Check] At line 482, if (now > distribution.last_updated) - can this be exploited if clock timestamp goes backwards or is manipulated? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: update_reward_buffer()] [Time Delta Overflow] At line 498, (now - last_update_time) is cast to u256 - can this overflow if last_update_time is in the far future? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: set_reward_rate()] [Last Update Timing] At line 433, update_reward_buffer is called before rate change - can an attacker manipulate clock to maximize rewards before rate decrease? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: create_reward_buffer_distribution()] [Initial Timestamp] At line 258 and 298, last_updated is set to clock.timestamp_ms() - is there validation that this timestamp is reasonable? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: add_reward_balance()] [Balance Join Safety] At line 363, reward_balance.join(reward) merges balances - can this fail silently if balance types mismatch? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: claim_reward()] [Insufficient Balance] At line 628, assert checks reward_amount <= balance, but is there a race condition where multiple claims drain the balance simultaneously? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: claim_reward()] [Balance Split Failure] At line 638, vault_reward_balance.split(reward_amount) is called - what happens if this fails after unclaimed_rewards was already reset? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: retrieve_undistributed_reward()] [Balance Mismatch] At lines 687-698, reward is split from reward_balances but buffer accounting is decreased separately - can this lead to balance/accounting desync? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: add_reward_to_buffer()] [Balance Storage] At lines 402-405, reward balance is joined to reward_balances but not tracked in buffer separately - is this intentional or could it cause confusion? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: update_reward_buffers() + claim_reward()] [State Race] At line 613, update_reward_buffers is called before claim - can an attacker sandwich this with add_reward_to_buffer to manipulate claimable amounts? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: add_new_reward_type() + add_reward_balance()] [Initialization Gap] If add_new_reward_type adds a type with zero balance at line 245, can add_reward_balance be called immediately causing issues with minimum amount checks? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: remove_reward_buffer_distribution() + set_reward_rate()] [Buffer Removal Race] Can set_reward_rate be called for a reward type while remove_reward_buffer_distribution is removing it, causing inconsistent state? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: update_reward_indices() + update_receipt_reward()] [Index Sync] When update_reward_indices increases global index at line 580, but update_receipt_reward hasn't been called yet, can users lose rewards? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: add_reward_balance()] [Zero Reward] If reward.value() is 0 at line 352, does to_decimals(0) pass the minimum_reward_amount check, potentially allowing spam transactions? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: set_reward_rate()] [Maximum Rate] At line 428, rate < u256::max_value!() / 86_400_000 limits rate, but is 86_400_000 the correct divisor for millisecond-based timestamps? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: update_reward_buffer()] [Zero Rate Period] At lines 483-489, if rate is 0, no rewards distribute - can this be exploited to freeze rewards indefinitely by setting rate to 0? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: update_reward_buffer()] [Remaining Zero Check] At line 504, if remaining_reward_amount == 0, last_updated advances but no distribution occurs - can this cause time-based reward loss? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: claim_reward()] [Zero Claim] If reset_unclaimed_rewards returns 0 at line 622, does split(0) at line 638 succeed, and is this gas-efficient? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: retrieve_undistributed_reward()] [Exact Amount] At lines 682-683, operator can retrieve exact amount - is there validation this doesn't leave buffer in broken state with non-zero rate but zero amount? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: check_version()] [Version Enforcement] At line 187, version must equal VERSION constant - but is check_version called in all critical functions, or can some be bypassed? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: upgrade_reward_manager()] [Downgrade Prevention] At line 193, assert!(self.version < VERSION) prevents downgrades, but can VERSION constant be manipulated in package upgrades? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: upgrade_reward_manager()] [State Migration] At lines 190-200, version is simply incremented - is there state migration logic needed for data structure changes between versions? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: create_reward_manager()] [Initial Version] At line 166, version is set to VERSION constant - what happens if RewardManager is created with wrong version during package upgrade transition? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: update_reward_indices()] [Index Increment] At line 578, add_index is added to current index - can extremely large reward_amount values cause index to grow unboundedly? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: update_receipt_reward()] [Index Application] At line 658, vault_receipt_mut.update_reward applies new index - is there protection against index decreases or manipulation? (High)
